q: Who founded the Brahmo Samaj in Calcutta in 1828?
desc: Raja Ram Mohan Roy founded the Brahmo Samaj in 1828 in Calcutta to promote monotheism and oppose idolatry, superstition, and sati.

q: What did Brahmo Samaj primarily oppose?
desc: Brahmo Samaj propagated monotheism and opposed sacrifices, idolatry, superstition, and the practice of sati.

q: Who led the Young Bengal Movement (1826-31)?
desc: Henry Louis Vivian Derozio was the leader of the Young Bengal Movement, which promoted truth, freedom, and rational thinking.

q: Which movement emphasized truth, freedom, and right?
desc: The Young Bengal Movement, led by Derozio, opposed social vices and believed in truth, freedom, and rights.

q: Who founded the Tattvabodhini Sabha in 1839?
desc: Debendranath Tagore founded the Tattvabodhini Sabha to propagate Brahmo Samaj ideas.

q: Which journal was brought out by the Tattvabodhini Sabha?
desc: Debendranath Tagore brought out the Tattvabodhini Patrika through the Tattvabodhini Sabha.

q: Who established the Dharma Sabha in 1820?
desc: Radhakant Deb founded the Dharma Sabha to counter Brahmo Samaj and promote orthodoxy.

q: Which movement was started by Syed Ahmed of Rai Bareilly in 1820?
desc: Syed Ahmed of Rai Bareilly led the Wahabi Movement, emphasizing Islamic reform based on the teachings of Waliullah.

q: What was the main idea of the Wahabi Movement?
pool: Unity of God and caste abolition
desc: The Wahabi Movement stressed individual conscience in religion and popularized Waliullah’s teachings.

q: Who were the leaders of the Namdhari or Kuka Movement (1841-71)?
pool: Debendranath Tagore and Rajaram Mohan Roy
Bhai Balak Singh and Baba Ram Singh
Dadoba Pandurang and Gopal Hari Deshmukh
answer: Bhai Balak Singh and Baba Ram Singh
desc: The Namdhari Movement was led by Bhai Balak Singh and Baba Ram Singh for political and social reforms among Sikhs.

q: The Namdhari Movement focused on reforms in which community?
desc: The Namdhari (Kuka) Movement aimed at reforming Sikh society both politically and socially.

q: Which movement was started by Dadoba Pandurang in 1849?
desc: Dadoba Pandurang founded the Paramhans Mandali which emphasized the unity of God and fought caste-based discrimination.

q: The Paramhans Mandali was against which social evil?
desc: The Paramhans Mandali opposed caste discrimination and emphasized spiritual unity.

q: Who founded the Rahnumai Mazdayasan Sabha in 1851?
desc: Rahnumai Mazdayasan Sabha was founded by S.S. Bengalee and Dadabhai Naoroji to uplift Parsis.

q: What was the aim of Rahnumai Mazdayasan Sabha?
desc: The Sabha aimed to improve social conditions of Parsis and restore purity to Zoroastrianism.

q: Which journal was associated with Rahnumai Mazdayasan Sabha?
desc: The Sabha published the journal 'Rast Goftar' to promote reformist ideas among Parsis.

q: Who founded the Prarthana Samaj in Bombay in 1867?
desc: Atmaram Pandurang founded the Prarthana Samaj in Bombay to promote monotheism and social reform.

q: What were the key reforms promoted by Prarthana Samaj?
desc: Prarthana Samaj supported monotheism, upliftment of women, and abolition of caste discrimination.

q: Which reformist founded the Indian Reform Association in 1870?
desc: Keshab Chandra Sen founded the Indian Reform Association advocating for women and inter-caste marriage.

q: Which social practice did the Indian Reform Association oppose?
desc: The Indian Reform Association opposed child marriage and promoted women’s rights and inter-caste marriage.

q: Which movement had its roots in Zoroastrian religion?
desc: This movement aimed at reforming the Zoroastrian community, especially the Parsis.

q: Which movement eventually led to the founding of Adi Brahmo Samaj?
desc: The Tattvabodhini Sabha's ideas eventually led to the formation of the Adi Brahmo Samaj.

q: Which reformer is regarded as the first modern nationalist poet?
desc: Derozio is considered the first modern nationalist poet of India, known for his progressive views.

q: Who founded the Arya Samaj in 1875?
desc: Dayanand Saraswati, originally named Mulshankar, founded the Arya Samaj in 1875 in Bombay.

q: What was the slogan given by Arya Samaj?
desc: Arya Samaj promoted the revivalist slogan 'Go Back to the Vedas' and opposed idol worship and caste supremacy.

q: Which movement was started by Syed Ahmed Khan?
desc: Syed Ahmed Khan initiated the Aligarh Movement to promote modern education among Muslims.

q: What was the journal started by Syed Ahmed Khan?
desc: Syed Ahmed Khan published 'Tahzib-al-Akhlaq' to promote social and religious reform among Muslims.

q: Which institution grew out of the Aligarh Movement?
desc: The Aligarh Movement led to the establishment of the Mohammedan Anglo-Oriental College, which became Aligarh Muslim University.

q: Who founded Theosophical Society in India?
desc: The Theosophical Society, founded by Madam HP Blavatsky and later joined by Col HS Olcott, drew inspiration from Indian philosophy.

q: The Theosophical Society was later shifted to which place in India?
desc: The Theosophical Society initially based in New York was later shifted to Adayar, India.

q: Which philosophical system inspired the Theosophical Society?
desc: The Theosophical Society was inspired by the Vedanta philosophy and Indian spiritual thought.

q: Who were among the founders of Deccan Education Society?
desc: MG Ranade, VG Chiplinkar, and GG Agarkar co-founded the Deccan Education Society in Pune.

q: What institution was established by the Deccan Education Society in 1885?
desc: Fergusson College was established in Pune in 1885 by the Deccan Education Society to promote education and culture.

q: Seva Sadan was founded by whom?
desc: Behramji M Malabari founded Seva Sadan in Bombay in 1885 to improve women’s rights and oppose child marriage.

q: What social issue did Seva Sadan address?
desc: Seva Sadan worked to abolish child marriages and support widows in India.

q: Who founded Deva Samaj in 1887?
desc: Deva Samaj was founded in Lahore in 1887 by Shiv Narain Agnihotri to promote ethical conduct and social reform.

q: Which of the following was promoted by Deva Samaj?
desc: Deva Samaj promoted ethical conduct, opposing bribery and gambling.

q: Who founded the Madras Hindu Association in 1892?
desc: Veeresalingam Pantulu founded the Madras Hindu Association to promote social reform and oppose the Devadasi system.

q: Which system did Madras Hindu Association oppose?
desc: The Madras Hindu Association opposed the exploitative Devadasi system as part of its social reform efforts.

q: Who founded the Ramakrishna Mission in 1897?
desc: Vivekananda, originally named Narendranath Dutta, founded the Ramakrishna Mission to promote spiritual and social service.

q: Which of the following was a key focus of Ramakrishna Mission?
desc: The Ramakrishna Mission aimed to revive Hinduism and remove social evils like caste discrimination.

q: Where was the Ramakrishna Mission established?
desc: The Ramakrishna Mission was established in Belur, West Bengal, by Vivekananda in 1897.

q: What is the original name of Dayanand Saraswati?
desc: Dayanand Saraswati was born as Mulshankar before founding the Arya Samaj.

q: Who among the following opposed idol worship strongly?
desc: Arya Samaj denounced idol worship and called for returning to Vedic principles.

q: Which reform movement emphasized equality in religion?
desc: The Aligarh Movement emphasized equality in religion and secular education.

q: Which journal advocated modern Islamic education?
desc: Syed Ahmed Khan's journal 'Tahzib-al-Akhlaq' was a platform for modern Islamic social reform.

q: Who among these was a key social reformer and editor?
desc: Behramji Malabari was a prominent reformer and editor who founded Seva Sadan.

q: What was one goal of Theosophical Society?
desc: The Theosophical Society believed in the transmigration of souls and ancient Indian wisdom.

q: Which reformer was originally named Narendranath Dutta?
desc: Vivekananda was born Narendranath Dutta before founding the Ramakrishna Mission.

q: In which year was Fergusson College established?
desc: Fergusson College was established in 1885 by the Deccan Education Society in Pune.

q: Which movement was focused on social purity and opposing the Devadasi system?
desc: The Madras Hindu Association campaigned for social purity and against the Devadasi system.

q: Who co-founded the Theosophical Society along with Blavatsky?
desc: Col HS Olcott joined HP Blavatsky in establishing the Theosophical Society.

q: Who founded the Servants of Indian Society in 1905?
desc: Gopal Krishna Gokhale founded the Servants of Indian Society in 1905 to promote social welfare.

q: What was the main focus of the Servants of Indian Society?
desc: The Servants of Indian Society focused on famine relief and improving tribal conditions.

q: Which organization was founded by Sarla Devi Chaudhrani in 1910?
desc: Sarla Devi Chaudhrani founded the Bharat Stri Mahamandal in Calcutta in 1910.

q: What was the main aim of Bharat Stri Mahamandal?
desc: The Bharat Stri Mahamandal aimed to promote women's education and their emancipation.

q: Who founded the Social Service League in 1911?
desc: NM Joshi founded the Social Service League in 1911 to improve conditions for the masses.

q: What was the main goal of the Social Service League?
pool: Improving the condition of the masses
answer: Improving the condition of the masses
desc: The Social Service League aimed at improving the living conditions of the general population.

q: Which organization was founded by Annie Besant in 1917?
desc: Annie Besant founded the Women's Indian Association in Madras in 1917 to support women's rights.

q: Where was the Women's Indian Association founded?
desc: The Women's Indian Association was established in Madras in 1917.

q: What was the key idea behind the Women's Indian Association?
desc: The Women's Indian Association worked toward uplifting Indian women socially and politically.

q: In which year was the Social Service League founded?
desc: The Social Service League was founded in 1911 by NM Joshi.
